Questions.Question: At what height above the ground is a nuclear explosion an Exo-Atmospheric Burst?
Questions.A: When the fireball is contained underwater
Questions.B: When the fireball just touches the surface of the ground or water
Questions.D: In excess of 3km above the earth's surface
Questions.E: In excess of 30km above the earth's surface
Questions.Answer: In excess of 30km above the earth's surface

Questions.Question: To help avoid a biological attack, pre-attack measures could include?
Questions.A: Immunise everyone against all known biological sources
Questions.B: Buying local produce and isolating water sources
Questions.D: Protecting food and water supplies, using approved sources only
Questions.E: Providing locals with food and hygiene training

Questions.Question: What is meant by the term Transmissibility?
Questions.A: The ability to pass from plant to animal
Questions.C: The ability to pass from one host to another
Questions.D: Germs you pass when not washing your hands
Questions.E: The agent cannot be passed by skin contact
Questions.Answer: The ability to pass from one host to another

Questions.Question: Which statement is the correct definition of a Non-persistent agent?
Questions.A: Vapours (or Aerosols) which disperses rapidly after release
Questions.B: Liquid which continues to present a long term hazard
Questions.C: Aerosols which remain in the air for days
Questions.D: When it turns three colour detector paper red
Questions.E: Vapours which stay in the air for a bit
Questions.Answer: Vapours (or Aerosols) which disperses rapidly after release

Questions.Question: Which statement is the correct definition of a Persistent Agent?
Questions.B: Liquid which continues to present a long term hazard
Questions.C: When it turns three colour detector paper red
Questions.D: Vapours or Aerosols which disperses rapidly after release

Questions.Question: Which, from the list below is the correct definition of a Biological Toxin?
Questions.A: A chemical product which can reproduce itself
Questions.B: A chemical product which is alive and causes disease in plants and animals
Questions.D: A chemical product from plants, animals or synthetically produced that cannot reproduce itself
Questions.Answer: A chemical product from plants, animals or synthetically produced that cannot reproduce itself
